data.title: Great new addition to 4th Street, San Rafael
data.text: Le Comptoir is a delightful new French restaurant.  Good food, attentive staff and vibrant atmosphere.  It is already busy so reservations are recommended.  Only open for dinner now, but soon to add lunch.  This restaurant will be a keeper.  Nice little shop attached to restaurant selling French goodies as well.

data.title: Wonderful bistro experience
data.text: This is just the kind of restaurant that will bring people back time after time: casual, and bright, welcoming staff & atmosphere, with an interesting typical French bistro menu. We enjoyed the sautéed provencal style squid starter, and then salmon with roasted asparagus. Everything was well prepared and delicious ! Our server was excellent and friendly. San Rafael residents are fortunate to now have Le Comptoir in their neighborhood.

data.title: Good downtown dinner, large wine selection
data.text: Grabbed dinner at the bar with a friend on Friday night. Busy but we got seated because the bar was available. Lots of wine to choose from! I had the beef cheeks with creamy polenta and a salad. It was very tasty, well seasoned and prepared. Not a giant menu but a good selection of items. Even though they were slammed the service was good and efficient. Prices were really good.

data.title: French Bistro-Great date night.
data.text: Walked from the Rafael theater.  Warm evening, so sat outside, reminding us of Paris cafes on the boulevard.  Attentive, charming owner.  Delicious escargot beignet.  Sweet breads and kale with puff pastry did not disappoint.  Le Burger was cooked perfectly medium rare with fries with aioli. Small list, but selective and delicious wines by the glass (we had French rose, Chardonnay, and a California Zinfandel) as well as nicely curated wine list, we'll be back to sample more.

data.title: A nice addition for San Rafael dining
data.text: We have been walk-ins twice here, but were always accomodated at the communal table in front. This is standard French bistro fare well prepared and paired with a nice selection of wines. I have yet to try a chacuterie plate. The staff is incredible helpful and friendly. They will always make sure you are happy. It is a shame there is not more space for outdoor dining, but the interior accomodates a lot of diners without feeling too crowded.

data.title: French cuisine returns to San Rafael
data.text: After more than a decade deprived since Le Petitie Auberge departed, San Rafael again has a French restaurant.  Le Comptoir does not disappoint.  The food is good, the wine list is appropriate, and with a good selection of wines by the glass.  Service is outstanding.  The entree selections could be a bit larger.  We were very pleased with the rotisserie chicken and the flat iron steak.  Bienvenue!

data.title: Has a lovely French market.
data.text: If you love French cheeses check out this Restaurant's little Market. They also have fresh made French Croissants, that are frozen to take home and bake in the oven.  YUM!

data.title: A little French with a twist, with a little market, for the best of Cheese Lovers.
data.text:
It was Monday night and a friend and I were in the area and hungry. We decided to try out a new place that had just opened up recently.  The place was packed,  on a Monday?  Ate at the Bar with a red French beer, French Onion Soup and Camembert Cheese Salad.  My friend had an ultimate Burger.  

The French Onion soup missed the mark, too much bread and not enough flavor, but the Camembert Salad was excellent.  According to my friend the Burger was one of the best she has ever had.

The thing that knocked me over was the little French Market they have as part of the restaurant.  These people are serious about good European Cheese.  Lovingly displayed in a special cooling room.  OMG what they have in there will give any Gourmet Cheese lover, the chills.  The rest of the market was filled with all sorts of interesting French imports.   One more thing that made me sing Hallelujah, was they had fresh made French croissants frozen in packages so you can take them home and pop them in the oven,   Now if you ever had real French croissants, you will know what I mean when I say, we are lucky to have this new place in the heart of Marin

data.title: All around great experience!!!
data.text:
5.0 star rating 4/24/2016
WOW!!! Marin County needed a place like this - contemporary, cool, sophisticated and downright welcoming and friendly all at the same time. And, lest I forget, the food and wine are amazing. We started with the beet salad and the ahi tuna. The multi-colored beets came out like a piece of modern art, but were not frou frou at all. Big chunks of beet with nuts and a light dressing drizzled on the plate. Yum. Tuna tartare was fresh with just enough heat from the wasabi aioli. I had the mussels and my partner had the pork tenderloin. Wow!!! I have to say, I enjoyed her dish even more than mine. Hers had a bed of cabbage with a DELICIOUS mustard sauce. Pork was medium rare and so juicy! As for the wine, I wish I could tell you what we drank. We let Stephan, the owner, just deliver his choices and they were all delicious. It's like he knew what we would like. We had a French champagne (I know that is redundant, but wanted to be clear) that he chose and described as "super sexy" and it was! We moved on to two different reds whose name we didn't know, but it didn't matter because they were delicious. We were so stuffed that after dinner, we did not have dessert, but Stephan delivered some port to us that was the perfect sweet ending to a fabulous dining experience. Service was friendly, prompt and attentive. And, all the diners were so chatty and happy! Looking around, the place was packed the entire evening with people waiting at the bar. Despite the crowd, it wasn't noisy and we could easily talk with each other or with our neighbors at the table next door, which we did throughout the night! Go!!! Make a reservation so you don't have to wait, although, that might not be so bad either!
